[b][color=white]HFNT - W4TCHL2ST - Recruiting Again[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url], leader of the HF News team, has recently announced a new wave of recruitment for the Writ3rs, the official usergroup responsible for running the HF News. All members of Writ3rs are required to be an Ub3r by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=515249][color=#EFEFEF][b]Sir[/b][/color][/url] has also stated that applicants must have excellent grammar, spelling, and comprehension of the English language as well as being knowledgeable of the happenings on Hack Forums. If you're interested in working on the HF News and meet the requirements, feel free to apply [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4373962][b]here[/b][/url]. 

[b][color=white]Member of The Month Changes[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] announced earlier this week that [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1320406][color=#EFEFEF][b]Froggy[/b][/color][/url] will be taking over the Member of The Month contest. This announcement came shortly after [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=827711][color=#EFEFEF][b]D3xus[/b][/color][/url] resigned from the position due to personal reasons. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1320406][color=#EFEFEF][b]Froggy[/b][/color][/url] has posted the new nomination thread for the July edition of Member of The Month, which can be found in the [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=56][b]HF l33t OT Discussions[/b][/url] section. If you are interested in nominating someone head over to [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4355471][b]MOTM Nominations - July 2014[/b][/url] and nominate the member you feel has contributed to the site the most in July of 2014.

[b][color=white]Private Investigation Methods and Anonymity Section[/color][/b]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has recently announced the addition of a new section to Hackforums. The section is called "[url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=322][b]Private Investigation Methods and Anonymity[/b][/url]" and resides as a sub-forum under the [url=http://hackforums.net/forumdisplay.php?fid=4][b]Beginner Hacking[/b][/url] section. The section's description is, "[i]Discuss privacy and remaining anonymous in this forum. Topics include finding private information and protecting your own data privacy.[/i]" The section is currently closed while [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] comes up with rules and policies specific to that section.

[color=white][b]Minor Wallet Bug Fixed[/b][/color]
The active users in the Omnicoin section has seen regular posts about an error reading "pfork != NULL". For a long time the developer team has been unable to fix it because it was difficult reproduce. The Astrocoin team recently submitted a pull request on the Omnicoin git repository, supposedly solving the issue.
New binary versions are currently waiting to be compiled, but the developers believe that it will be out soon. In case you stumble upon this bug before the fix is released, you can delete all files in the folder %APPDATA%\Omnicoin [b][i]except[/i][/b] wallet.dat and omnicoin.conf. The client will redownload the blockchain and you will be able to use it again.

[color=white][b]Allcrypt Frozen[/b][/color]
Around July 28th, 2014, 4 PM UTC, Allcrypt suddenly stopped processing trades. This left several users confused. Later the same day, Allcrypt marked their Omnicoin wallet as being under maintenance, and the downtime continued until around August 1st at 5 PM UTC.

[color=white][b]Everything About Omnicoin - Live[/b][/color]
While the Omnicoin enthusiasts are eagerly waiting for Omniscient's next move, it seems to have become a sport to get an overview of every single aspect of the coin. [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1354902].Matt[/url]'s website, [url]omc-live.com[/url], has for a long time been providing users with live stats about the different pools, uptime statistics and more. More recently, [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1354902].Matt[/url] has implemented a copy of [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1088934]Crypto‚Ñ¢[/url]'s mining calculator, including some features from the one created by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=392740]The Moen[/url]. At the time of writing, the calculator lets you know the value of the coin, how much you will be able to earn mining, and how much you will have to pay to earn them through rented mining power.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Why so much hate on Minecraft? I'm always interested to hear peoples reasons for this.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1166170][color=#EFEFEF][b]z–∞—Åh:[/b][/color][/url] Honestly, not much the site is running pretty well, however, maybe something with group sells, it seems pretty unfair with the current process. I understand that Omni doesn't want just anyone to buy it, but the rates are just ridiculous imho. Something needs to be done about the pricing of them.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] I think that $10,000+ for a group is insane, I'd consider buying one if it was 1/3 of that price. On a scale of 1-10 how would you rate your overall experience on Hack Forums?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1166170][color=#EFEFEF][b]z–∞—Åh:[/b][/color][/url] Anywhere around 5-7k seems like a doable price imho. I would rate my experience a 8 out of 10. I've run into unpleasant members, and rules that are annoying, but hey you'll always find ass hole members & and rules/regulations you dislike on just about everything.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=797403][color=#22C997][b]630:[/b][/color][/url] Well I think that's about all the time I have for this interview. Do you have any final remarks you'd like to make for us today?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1166170][color=#EFEFEF][b]z–∞—Åh:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks for interviewing me üéâ[/spoiler]

[color=deepskyblue][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033]Xerotic[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=]
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Welcome to this weeks edition of the HF News. Today I'm here with fellow Writ3r and ladies man Xerotic. What's up Z? Any shoutouts's you'd like to make before we proceed?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Thanks Clark, I'd like to give a shoutout to Saturday, RDCA, and yourself. Also all my Mentor buddies!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Terrific. Would you mind telling us what some of your interests consist of? Besides sending me terrible Snapchats?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] I really enjoy making Userscripts and just programming in general. Outside of HF I play flag football weekly and exercise a lot. And my snapchats are always inspiring and full of awe, don't lead people wrong üòÅ

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] I'd be lying if I said I wasn't a little inspired. As someone who has been programming for quite a few years now -- care to offer any advice to those looking to learn? Often times people can get discouraged since programming isn't exactly easy. How did you avoid giving up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Well one thing that I wish I had was somebody to speak to directly to help learn from. Having a capable programmer to help you in person or over phone/chat will be great help. Also, diligence. It will take time before you can make huge programs, websites, or games. But it pays off in the long run. For me personally, I just loved programming so there was nothing that could discourage me. I had a lot of time to invest into learning at the time.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Interesting, like a Mentor you mean? If only I had one of those. You've had the same avatar on HF for four years now correct? Why don't you change it? Are you afraid of change?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] I feel that my avatar is part of my profile at this point. A lot of people recognize me just by that image. Change never hurt anyone, but in my case it just makes sense to keep it :)

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Would you mind telling the readers five interesting things about yourself?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Interesting things? Hmm...
1.) I make my living working from home.
2.) I have a nose comparable in size to Shock G's nose.
3.) I self-taught all my programming skills.
4.) I use to make my own pickles from vegetables that I grew.
5.) I know more about Harry Potter than any other HF member.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Wow, I'd assume you'd tell is stuff that didn't make you come off as a huge loser. Fascinating. You were once staff back in the day, what was that like? Would you ever want to become Staff again?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Well I could have told you things that would make me seem like a champion, but people should ready know that.
And I was Staff back in 2011. It was a great experience and definitely something I would do again if offered. Going through the reports could be good or bad - all depending on the day. Usually it wasn't any problem. I have been a Mentor since September 2011 and it is completely different. Now I just help answer questions and remove/close threads that violate policy as I see them while browsing.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] Well you're doing a fine job as Mentor if I do say so myself. That should go a long way with Omni. I'm to understand that you're a ladies man, do you have any advice for people that are struggling with woman? (Yellows in particular)
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Stay clean and work on smell, cologne and mouthwash/gum. Beyond that you just have to look decent and start talking. Nothing will happen if you don't say something, and fast. Don't waste time. A wasted hour/day/week/month debating on asking someone on a date is just that, wasted time. First impressions matter so be prepared and gain a personality.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] You're cute. If you could make one change to HF what would that be and why? (You can't suggest an HTML/CSS section)
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] Gauth to be finished would be great. Also an HF api for integrating in the site would be super for developers. I might make a MyBB plugin for it.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] How important is math in terms of programming? Do you find it's essential to be good with numbers?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] It is vastly important with game development. Strong skills in all math areas is definitely needed for advanced game making. Otherwise basic math knowledge will get you through other development... but ultimately the more math skill you have the more likely programming will catch easier with you.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1653635][b][color=#DDA0DD]Clark:[/color][/b][/url] That's all the time we have for today, thanks for Joining us Xerotic. If you have any closing statements you'd like to make now is the time :)
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=175033][color=#EFEFEF][b]Xerotic:[/b][/color][/url] I'd like to thank you for the interview opportunity. Look forward to any new Userscripts I might be releasing! And as always, you stay classy HackForums.[/spoiler]

[align=center]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1189774][color=#EFEFEF][b]Bandors[/b][/color][/url] & [b][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1173142][color=#EFEFEF]Goodies[/color][/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Kali Linux 1.0.8 - Supports UEFI[/color][/b]
[url=http://kali.org]Kali Linux[/url] is a rolling release distribution with specialized tools for network and website security based on one of the most popular and stable Linux distributions, [url=https://www.debian.org/]Debian[/url]. Kali Linux is not a considerably stable distribution and it is not meant to be installed as an everyday use operating system but rather one simply for testing security. For this reason, the developers purposely left out a beginner-friendly setup. Kali is one among many tools in almost every Hacker's toolbox. However, the developers of [url=http://kali.org]Kali Linux[/url] have, in an attempt to simplify the use of Kali and perhaps broaden the targetted , especially for those with newer hardware, incorporated support for UEFI.

[b][color=white]Intel Solid State Drive Pro 2500 Encrypt Themselves![/color][/b]
Intel(R) has created a Solid State Drive (SSD) that provides reliable, high-speed storage and manageable, robust security. For those that don't know, a Hard Disk Drive (HDD) is a disk with a magnetic coating that is written to with a laser. Solid State Drives uses arrays of flash chips that do not require power to save information. Though they are similar to Flash USB Thumb Drives, they differ in speed, type, and stability of memory. They are orders of magnitude faster, more stable/reliable, and robust than HDD's. This particular SSD is equipped with hardware-based 256-bin encryption. The reason for the encryption is an increased demand by customers. 
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/Gm7w7ET.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=255459]Delirium‚Ñ¢[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Half Of The Most Famous Android Applications Are Vulnerable[/color][/b]
According to the researchers who found the "Heartbleed" bug (Codenomicon company), half of the 50 most famous Android apps are still vulnerable, due to irresponsible library recycling. One of Codenomicon's study reported that many of the top-list applications are sending sensitive data to third parties, such as the phone's number, the IMEI code, the location of the phone etc. The most shocking part however, is the fact that this data is transmitted in plain text (!). The head of Codenomicon stated that those bugs occur in a broad spectrum, due to the reuse of libraries and the refusal of programmers to write new code for their applications.

[b][color=white]Intel Announces Self-Encrypted Drives[/color][/b]
Intel has announced the deployment of a new model of SSD drives, under the name "Drive Pro 2500" which will have the ability to encrypt itself. A fact that, according to Intel, will prevent data from being read by third parties. The new SSD series will be primarily addressed to companies and its capacity will be either 120, 180, 240, 360 Gigabytes. Intel assures that their new drive will provide random input/output functionality per second (IOPS) and the read/write speed will be 540/490 MBps.

[b][color=white]SQL Injection Exploit For vBulletin 5.x[/color][/b]
A Romanian hacktivist group named "Romanian Security Team", or RST in short, has released an exploit which targets vBulletin 5.x platform versions. For those who are not aware, vBulletin is one of the biggest forum engines and according to its company, the security it provides is very high. One of the team's members posted the exploit's code on their forums and has provided information on how to use it in order to gain access to the database of a vBulletin 5.x forum. The code was provided for free whereas, other hacking teams were asking for 2,000 USD in Bitcoins for the code. On the other side, vBulletin has released a patch and fixed the vulnerability, a day after the exploit was released.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][img]http://i.imgur.com/TvznEMg.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1698590]Abide[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1079277]Harlem[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Sense Sleep Monitors You While You Sleep, Wakes You Up At Best Time[/color][/b]
A lot of times when people sleep, they often wake up feeling more tired than when they fell asleep. This feeling also comes with a feeling of crankiness, among other things. Sense aims to help with these feelings. Sense is a new device, which looks like a ball of rubber bands, which monitors your sleeping habits and environmental conditions. The device comes with a smaller device called a "Sleep Pill" which tracks your movements throughout the night, all from under your pillow. The devices collect the data throughout the night, and then relay that information to your phone, which gives you an in-depth look at how you slept. Sense is on Kickstarter at the moment, and have reached their goal of funding. If you hurry in you can get the device and one Sleep Pill by pledging $99 to the cause.

[b][color=white]Data Cuisine Takes Culinary Exploration And Experimentation To A New Level[/color][/b]
Experimenting with food is nothing new, seeing as most unique tastes come from experimenting with different flavors. We have seen some unusual food pairings before, courtesy of IBM's Watson, but now, Data Cuisine is taking this to a whole new level. Data Cuisine was made by Mortiz Stefaner, who is a data-visualization specialist, and Susanne Jashchko, who curates with him. Data Cuisine is an initiative to create recipes from a set of statistics, and then have those recipes made available. Data Cuisine takes many different statistics into account when making recipes, and each statistic makes up a different ingredient in the recipe, which then translates into a cohesive dish. For example, data used in Helsinki, such as fishing data, ethnic population stats, and crime rates were translated into an array of different recipes and dishes. The whole point behind this is that every culinary decision made has a statistical backing, and was chosen for a reason. Data Cuisine is looking to expand to more and more cities as time goes on.

[b][color=white]IBM's Watson Gets A New Life - Reintroducing Soldiers To A Civilian Lifestyle[/color][/b]
Watson has been used for many things in the past, from Jeopardy games to culinary experimentation, but now the supercomputer has a new and much more important job, reintroducing soldiers fresh out of combat to a more normal and civilian life. IBM has teamed up with USAA, who has been helping soldiers and their families for years, to create an application to answer veterans' questions about finances and other things along those lines. A simple example would be an ex-soldier asking the app what his insurance covers, what the GI Bill is about, or even how to get a job. Watson has had many different jobs over the years, but it was all commercial and industrialized. This is more consumer based than anything, and is a general good use for this supercomputer. The app itself pulls its data from over 3,000 documents that handle military transitions, with the hopes of helping the 150,000 plus soldiers retiring every year. 

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1093501]Roger Waters[/url] & [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1030620]CyborgIzSoBeast[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Microsoft To Shut Down Xbox Entertainment Studios[/color][/b]
Last week, Microsoft announced that it will by laying off over 18,000 employees, the most in the history for the company. Included with this, Microsoft will be closing Xbox Entertainment Studios in the next few months. Xbox Entertainment Studios was responsible for bringing original programming and video content to the Xbox platforms, such as a planned "Halo" television show produced by Steven Spielberg and a reality TV show which launched last month, called "Every Street United." In a statement released by Phil Spencer, head of the 200-person Xbox Entertainment Studios and the Xbox division of Microsoft, stated that programs announced will still be produced as planned. Included with this is the TV show based on the "Halo" series, a documentary titled "Signal to Noise," and more. "Xbox will continue to support and deliver interactive sports content like 'NFL on Xbox,' and we will continue to enhance our entertainment offering on console by innovating the TV experience through the monthly console updates. Additionally, our app partnerships with world-class content providers bringing entertainment, sports and TV content to Xbox customers around the world are not impacted by this organizational change." This change may not come as a surprise as Microsoft made no announcements or even mentions about original programming at its E3 press conference this year, and recently announced a Kinect-less Xbox One, which may hint that the company will slowly drift away from original programming and TV experiences and features.

[b][color=white]Nvidia Unveils Gaming Tablet to Spread Chips Into Devices[/color][/b]
Nvidia Corp. (NVDA), trying to prove the value of its chips in mobile devices by appealing to gamers, will begin selling a tablet computer under its Shield brand. The Shield Tablet, which comes in two models, an 8-inch screen, one with Wi-Fi only for $299 and one with a cellular connection that will retail for $399, the Santa Clara, California-based company said. It‚Äôs also offering a companion wireless controller for $59. The device will debut in the U.S. this month and Europe in August. Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jen-Hsun Huang is trying to reduce his company‚Äôs reliance on its core product of chips for add-in graphics cards in personal computers. Instead, he wants to spread the use of that kind of processing to other devices. Shield Tablet, based on the company‚Äôs K1 chip and Google Inc.‚Äôs Android operating system, is also designed to show Android can be the basis of high-end gaming machinery.

[b][color=white]Bungie explains why Destiny will not support cross-platform play[/color][/b]
In an interview this week with Bungie engineer Roger Wolfson, we have finally found an explanation into why Bungie will not allow cross-platform play on their new video game, Destiny. Roger Wolfson explained that Bungie will not allow cross-platform play for Destiny because they do not want players to feel like they are at a disadvantage when playing against someone on a next-gen console or against someone playing on the PC. In the interview with Digital Trends, he goes on to explain that cross-platform won't be allowed because some players will perceive an advantage during multiplayer matches when playing on more powerful hardware.  ‚ÄúI‚Äôll speak for the hypothetical player,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI have a disadvantage sniping across the map because [my opponent with a next-gen console] is only two pixels on my screen and I‚Äôm four pixels on his. You see that in the world of PC gaming, where people are always racing to the best video card to give themselves the advantage. Regardless of where the reality is, there‚Äôs definitely a perception among gamers that better hardware means you have an advantage,‚Äù he added. ‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt want to have to enter that fray, so to create the best, most level playing field, both actually and perceptually, we separated it by platform.‚Äù Destiny is scheduled to be released on September 9, 2014 for the Play Station 3, Play Station 4, Xbox 360, and the Xbox One.

[b][color=white]LittleBigPlanet 3 to begin in August[/color][/b]
According to the community manager of the LittleBigPlanet fansite LBPCentral, A private beta for LittleBigPlanet 3 is planned to begin in August. In a statement he says: ‚ÄúA small number of LittleBigPlanet Central users have been hand-picked to be part of the upcoming beta. Those who are lucky enough to be chosen will be sent a private message to their LittleBigPlanet Central accounts with a code for the beta over the next couple of weeks.‚Äù He goes on to say, ‚ÄúPlease be aware that space for this private beta is incredibly limited and only a small number of you will actually receive an invitation, however we thought it would be better than you hear about this private beta directly from us than just through the grapevine. So please don‚Äôt be discouraged if you didn‚Äôt get chosen this time around‚Ä¶ We still have plenty of news to share with everyone between now and release. And we certainly won‚Äôt forget you all.‚Äù LittleBigPlanet 3 is scheduled to be released on the Play Station 3 and Play Station 4 in November of this year, and will be co-developed by Sony Xdev and Sumo Digital Studios.

[b][color=white]Aorus Launches the Thunder M7 MMO Gaming Mouse[/color][/b]
The newest addition to the roster of MMO gaming peripherals comes from Aorus that has announced its Aorus Thunder M7 gaming mouse that features 16 programmable buttons. According to Aorus, "The Aorus Thunder M7 is specifically designed for MMO gamers, who emphasize on emitting accurate and fast attack commends at the battlefield; therefore, Aorus developed the best allocation of the MMO hot-keys with great effort and time to bring the most ergonomically mouse for the gamers." Of the 16 programmable buttons, 11 of them are located on the sides. Eight of those buttons are located on the left side of the mouse. For those wishing to change the device‚Äôs DPI on the go there are two buttons assigned to change it from 800 DPI to 8200 DPI. If you are worried about the durability of the buttons then you should know that, according to Aorus, the Thunder M7 is equipped with Omron switches that are expected to last up to 20 million clicks. It also has the Aorus Macro Engine built-in that allows users to switch between five different gaming profiles.

[b][color=white]GTA 4 Keeps Getting Better-Looking on PC[/color][/b]
The creators of the iCEnhancer mod for Grand Theft Auto IV has released a new update (3.0 update). A wide variety of graphical improvements for GTA IV have been added or further refinded and a lot of other improvements came along with this also but we will be linking you to the changelog below along with a video which showcases the extent to which GTA IV's graphics are overhauled.The mod's official website has crashed due to the flood of traffic it's received in the wake of the update's release, but the mod can still be downloaded elsewhere in the meantime. For those suffering low frame rates, a post on the mod's Facebook page offers some advice--the mod, understandably, is more resource-intensive than the game, which is a system hog in its own right. It's suggested that players open the file "icenhancer_config.txt," where you can tweak options to improve performance. "By default, it's on high quality," the post explains. "Reduce the godray quality, mostly to medium or low."

[sp=Changelog][img]http://i5.minus.com/jb1JdiSfSavsYl.jpg[/img][/sp][/align]

[b][color=white]Updated Steam Controller Prototype Includes a Thumbstick[/color][/b]
Valve has updated their Steam controller once again, adding an analog stick on the left-hand side this time around. An image in the spoiler below was pulled from the latest beta for the Steam Client, courtesy of SteamDB (via Engadget), and shows that this new thumbstick will replace the four directional buttons that appears on previous designs of the controller. This may be a good change for users who are more used to a modern, traditional design of a game controller. If you haven't been keeping track, this isn't the first design of a Steam Controller. The original design featured two track pads on both sides of the controller, with likeness to a touch screen. The original design was scrapped back in January and reduced the size of the trackpads and added two sets of buttons to the face of the controller. At this point in time, it is not known if there will any more revisions of this controller, or if this will be the final design that will be released for sale in the future.

[align=center][b]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1213511]On—ñx[/url][/b][/align]
[align=center][spoiler=][align=left]

[b][color=white]Supposedly Leaked Sapphire Display from iPhone 6 Stress Tested [/color][/b]
MKBHD's video [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5R0_FJ4r73s]"iPhone 6 Sapphire Crystal Display!"[/url] gained a large amount of media attention as he was handling what he claimed is a display from the iPhone 6. He does several stress tests with knives and keys and the screen shows no scratches, even after he puts serious pressure on it. He then goes on to try to snap it with his hands and his feet, still with no result. As he got so much attention from worldwide newsgroups he then released another video titled [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b7ANcWQEUI8]"iPhone 6 Sapphire: Explained!"[/url] which covered the fact that it is not pure Sapphire crystal like the TouchID home button and that it can be scratched if you really want to scratch it. At the end of the second video he proves that it is indeed, not indestructible. The iPhone 6 will be released alongside iOS 8 around the usual mid September window.

[b][color=white]iOS 8 Beta 4 Released[/color][/b]
The 4th in line of Betas from Apple for their new version of iOS has been released. It is available for anyone who is currently on another Beta via OTA or for any Developer Account holders via iTunes and the Apple Dev Centre. It includes the usual small bug fixes that these releases always have but it also has some reasonable new additions. The 'Bug Reporter' app from Betas 1, 2, and 3 has been removed and a new stock app called 'Tips' has been added which details all of iOS' features in a neat and simple way for new users. Another big change is the design of Control Centre, the blurring and shading scheme is completely different in this beta and now seems inconsistent with other features' colours like the Notification Centre. We can only wait and see if they give other parts the same makeover.

[b][color=white]Top Cydia Repositories ZodTT & MacCiti, InsanelyI, and BigBoss all hacked[/color][/b]
After Saurik's recent blog post on Competition vs. Community and the upcoming Cydia competitor iMods some activists have taken it to themselves to 'promote competition'. The group behind all of this is going by the name of Kim-Jong Cracks and is posting all paid packages from BigBoss and ZodTT & MacCiti for free on their own repository. Their site is http://cracksby.kim/ and the sites specifically for the recent hacks are http://ripzodttd.com/ and http://ripbigboss.com/ . So far not much is known about the group at all and Saurik has not yet commented on the events but we are all sure he will soon have to face it.

[b][color=white]Verizon to Now Throttle Data on Grandfathered Unlimited Data Plans[/color][/b]
Starting October 1st, whenever anyone on an Unlimited Data plan goes over 4.7GB in a month they will be throttled. People who have new, non-unlimited plans are not affected. It seems Verizon is trying to push people to their newer, more expensive plans that have less data. Verizon claim that this will only affect the 'top 5%' of data users but 4.7GB isn't exactly a lot when you have what they claim is 'Unlimited'. It's odd that a company with so little going for it would completely cripple the only reason a large amount of users stay with it. So if you are one of the few with good T-Mobile reception in your area, flock to them to keep your Netflix habit possible.

[b][color=white]Fight For Libya Airport Leaves 50 Dead[/color][/b]
France and Britain have ordered citizens to leave Libya after what some are describing as "the worst outbreak of violence since Gaddafi's ouster." For the last two weeks there has been a raging battle for Libya's airport Tripoli, which has left over a hundred dead and an estimated four hundred injured. The battle is being fought between Islamist militants who are trying to wrestle control of the airport from Zintan militia. Many embassies located in Libya are evacuating personnel, with the US evacuating over 150 staff with fighter planes, helicopters and armored vehicles protecting them.

[b][color=white]Ebola Scare In Liberia[/color][/b]
After news of a doctor working in Liberia helping the joint SIM/Samaritan's Purse team has contracted Ebola and died, news quickly followed of a second American aids worker testing positive. The Ebola virus is known to be highly infectious and with no current treatment specific to the virus, it is hard to combat. The best way to support a victim is to balance fluids and electrolytes to prevent dehydration. Health officials say the current outbreak of Ebola is the deadliest ever with over 1,000 people testing positive and a suspected 660 dying from it. The current outbreak is centralized in West Africa, mainly Liberia but is suspected to spread quickly if not quarantined. 

[b][color=white]Ten Die In Japanese Heat Wave[/color][/b]
Ten people have died, and an estimated 1,400 were taken to hospital due to the temperatures soaring in Japan. The main cause of injury was heat stroke or heat exhaustion a report has shown. Twenty of those taken to hospital remain in serious condition according to the report, and many are still on high alert. The heat wave struck as a high-pressure system in the Pacific Ocean sent a blanket of warm air to Japan. The highest reported heat was in the city of Higashiomi in Shiga Prefecture, which reported a record breaking 38.8 degrees Celsius (102 degrees Fahrenheit), and many other cities had record-breaking temperatures.

[b][color=white]How to Easily Convert Carbon Dioxide to Methanol[/color][/b]
Scientists at the U.S. Department of Energy's Brookhaven National Laboratory have discovered new means of converting Carbon dioxide, an easily accessible element, into a more petroleum and industry wide usable substance. They unveiled that it was possible to convert Carbon Dioxide into methanol with greater yields than with previous methods. This is done through their newly discovered catalytic system. This is revolutionary for it is creating a popular key commodity in the industry. The benefit of this new system is that this catalytic system will make normally nonreactive carbon dioxide reactive. 

[b][color=white]Chili Peppers Prevent Tumor![/color][/b]
Researchers at the University of California, San Diego School of Medicine found that an active ingredient in red chili peppers, capsaicin, 
that ultimately triggers receptors to aid in limiting the risk of colorectal tumors. The receptor called TRPV1was originally discovered inside sensory neurons, where it reacts to heat and acidity. This receptor stimulates the linings of the intestine tract and can help prevent tumors in this area. This is because capsaicin induces the same reaction that heat and acidic elements do because of the spice. This lining acts as an effective tumor suppressor.

[b][color=white]Calorie Burning Catalyst in Brown Fat[/color][/b]
Biologists at the Scripps Research Institute have identified a signaling pathway that switches on a powerful calorie-burning process in brown fat cells. These new fat cells have become of interest to scientists because they stimulate natural weight loss and prevent diabetes. Researchers say that the fat cells that humans who are obese typically have are white fat cells. They contain these cells in excess, which are maintained because of overeating and lack of exercise, tricking the body into thinking that the human is bingeing in case of famine. Other mammals, however have brown fat cells which burn energy rather than store. Researchers are now exploring ways to trigger this fat storing cell.

[b][color=white]A Genetic Link to Schizophrenia[/color][/b]
An important part of diagnosing and treating mental illnesses is trying to find their underlying causes. A collaborative group of more than 80 institutes has announced that they've made huge progress in identifying a possible cause for schizophrenia. By analyzing data from over 150 000 participants, the researchers were able to identify 108 gene sequences in the human genome that may be responsible for causing schizophrenia. The results were announced the same day philanthropist Ted Stanley donated $650 million to psychiatric research.

[b][color=white]Gut Virus Found in over Half of the Population[/color][/b]
Researchers from San Diego State University have found a virus they believe lives in the digestive systems of over half of the world's population. The virus, named crAssphage, is a type of virus known as a bacteriophage, which targets and infects bacteria. In this case, the common gut bacterium [i]Bacteriodetes[/i], which has connections to diabetes and obesity among other stomach-relative disorders, is the target. By isolating the virus, they hope to determine what role it plays in these debilitating diseases.

[b][color=white]Understanding the Nervous System's Role in Asthma[/color][/b]
Asthma, a common and debilitating breathing disorder, is responsible for over 250 000 deaths worldwide each year. It has been long understood to be a disorder of the immune system, but failure of treatments that target immune response hint that the immune system is only partially responsible. A research group led by Dmitri Tranker has discovered that sensory neurons containing a TRPV1 receptor play a role in controlling bronchial hyperactivity. By suppressing the activity of these neurons in the lungs, the researchers were able to decrease asthma symptoms. They believe that more work should be done into studying how these results may be used to treat asthma in the future.

[b][color=white]A Human Symptoms-Disease Network[/color][/b]
When we get sick, our physical symptoms are higher-level manifestations of a multitude of changes at the molecular level. This area is not well understood, but plans are being made to change this. A huge database of diseases known as the human symptoms-disease network (HSDN) is in the process of being made. It is a huge database of over 4000 diseases and their underlying symptoms, including mechanisms at the protein and genetic level. The goal of the database is to provide a new symptoms-level view of the diseases in hopes to provide better care and control in the future.

[b][color=white]A Hard-to-Abuse Narcotic[/color][/b]
With the rise of prescription drug abuse, intense pressure has been placed on the pharmaceutical industry to develop strong painkillers with limited abuse potential. Even in patients who have no intention of abuse, addiction can easily happen. The FDA has recently approved a new drug which hopes to curb that problem. It combines the powerful opiate oxycodone with naloxone, a drug that blocks the euphoria characteristic of opiate highs. The approval came after a successful trial on 600 patients, where the medication proved itself to be effective in reducing abuse.

[b][color=white]Antibiotic Resistance in the Sewers[/color][/b]
Wastewater treatment plants are hugely responsible for the ever-growing problem of antibiotic-resistant bacteria, according to researchers. The plants serve as a huge ecosystem where multiple types of bacteria come together. This allows them to exchange genetic information via horizontal gene transfer, which is how bacteria pass on resistance mechanisms. The researchers say they underestimated the role these plants play in the problem, which was recently promoted to epidemic status by the World Health Organization. 

[color=white][b]Running 5-10 minutes.[/b][/color]
Adults were recommended, at their age, to run approximately 75 minutes weekly to stay in physical shape. A new study from Iowa State University shows that running at a slow speed, for 5-10 minutes a day could reduce mortality rate. Study also shows running more could do more harm than good. Ultimately, running could add up to three years to your life expectancy. During follow-up, 3,413 participants died from all-causes, while 1,217 died from cardiovascular causes. The scary side? 24% of these people maintained a weekly basis running cycle. The study also concluded that participants who engaged in running each week were 30% less likely to die from all-causes and 45% less likely to die from cardiovascular causes, compared with those who did not participate in running. At the end of the road, study suggests running more will make you live longer. 

[color=white][b]Inflammatory diseases cause more issues.[/b][/color]
Senior citizens who suffer from polymyalgia rheumatica (causes pain and stiffness) are now more at risk for strokes and heart attacks. A study held in UK examined 3,249 patients with polymyalgia rheumatica and 12,735 patients who did not have this condition. Both groups treated by state of the art physicians, none having history of vascular disease. After closely following these participants for 12 years, they have concluded: polymyalgia rheumatica patients had a higher risk of all vascular diseases, including angina, heart attack, atherosclerosis and stroke. Study also showed these were the highest within the first 6-12 months of diagnosis. There are no known differences between men and women.

[color=white][b]Fist pumps more "hypogenic".[/b][/color]
A UK study shows fish s are more are hygienic than shaking hands and should be used in public more often to help prevent the spread of germs. Results show fist pumps to spread 90% fewer germs than hand shaking. After dipping gloves inside E coli. broth, researchers exchanged handshakes and fist pumps back and forth and tested the gloves to see the amount of germs transferred with each handshake. Handshaking transmitted the highest amount of potential disease while a "high five" reduced this by 50%. The germ transfer during the first fist pump was 90% lower than a handshake. Ultimately, the team concluded the stronger the handshake, the more bacteria to be exchanged. 

[color=white][b]Trees are saving our lives.[/b][/color]
Trees are also known to affect the quality of the air by directly removing air pollutants. Current research has showed urban trees in the US remove roughly 700,000 tons of pollution per year. Four pollutants were accessed in this study: nitrogen dioxide, ozone, sulfur dioxide and particulate matter which showed less than 2.5 microns in aerodynamic diameter. In 2005, a US study showed PM2.5 was linked to an estimated 130,000 while 4,000 of those deaths were linked to the ozone layer itself. After various studies, researchers were able to conclude trees 'remove less than 1% pollution'. Even something so little has a giant impact on this environment in which we live. It has been estimated, per year, 850 human lives are saved as part of this air quality movement, and roughly 670,000 causes of respiratory symptoms are suppressed and or prevented. As following results, Michael T. Rains, director of the Forest Service's Northern Research Station and the Forest Products Laboratory, says:

[quote]"With more than 80% of Americans living in urban areas, this research underscores how truly essential urban forests are to people across the nation. Information and tools developed by Forest Service research are contributing to communities valuing and managing the 138 million acres of trees and forests that grace the nation's cities, towns and communities."[/quote]

[b][color=white]Restoring a 19th Century Sail Ship[/color][/b]
After almost a century of sitting at the docks, the Charles W. Morgan is now ship-shape after a five year restoration process. This ship is now able to show the history of whaling at Mystic Seaport in Connecticut. It is the second oldest ship in America only after the U.S.S. Constitution. Unlike many other Whaling ships, The Charles W. Morgan can be seen in its top form while other original Whaling ships must be studied from the sea floor as shipwrecks. Many take for granted the products of the oil that came from whales at the time. At one point, whale oil was the main source of illumination in lights and candles and nearly every home in the U.S. had some form of whale oil product. Looking at the ship now, it is almost like something out of a fairy tail, magnificent. 

[b][color=white]Violence Helping to Drive the U.S. Boarder Crisis[/color][/b]
In Latin American, there is a great number of people that would risk anything to make it across the southern U.S. boarder. Some have even attempted the journey more than once unsuccessfully, many of these immigrants being unaccompanied minors. More than 55,000 have crossed this year alone, many from Honduras, specifically due to its recent high murder rates. Many U.S. politicians are currently trying to find a solution to this recently high influx of immigrants, especially for the children that have made the journey alone. One can only hope for the best.

During this month, most know that Muslims are required to fast from sunrise to sunset. However, to them this is a small price to pay for the festivities that occur. It is said that the gates to heaven open during Ramadan and the gates to hell are closed. This holiday as a whole is about purifying oneself from malicious thoughts and thinking about God. The end of this month is celebrated through a three day Eid al-Fitr or "Festival of Fast-Breaking." As many Muslims would say, no religion brings so many people together in one place, and in a lot of ways, this is true.[/align][/spoiler][/align]

Speaking about their meeting, Trombone Shorty said, "He was full of joy, thankful and happy. I think we were both very excited to speak to each other. He seems like a cool kid and I'm happy that after a situation like that, I can help to put a smile on his face." The identity of the boy involved has not been released due to security concerns.

[b][color=white]iPhones Killed Autographs[/color][/b]
According to Taylor Swift, iPhones are destroying the tradition of obtaining autographs from celebrities and musicians. Swift claimed that she hasn't been asked for an autograph since the advent of front-facing iPhone cameras. "All that kids these days want is a selfie", said Swift in interview. She went on to describe how mp3 technology has severely impacted album sales. Swift feels that nowadays, people only purchase physical CDs if they find an album particularly poignant or personal to them, presenting a new challenge for the artists of today.
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[b][color=white]Sam Raimi to Produce The Last Of Us[/color][/b]
After months of speculation, it was revealed at Comic-Con that there would indeed be a big screen adaptation of the hit game, [i]The Last of Us[/i]. Game creator Neil Druckmann had also revealed at Comic-Con that the actress Maisie Williams ‚Äì best known for her role as Arya in [i]Game Of Thrones[/i] - is in talks to play the role of Ellie. Druckmann made the announcement alongside Sam Raimi, who is set to produce the big-screen version of the PS3 horror hit. For those of you who have never played the game, it was released in 2013. The game is set in a zombie-ravaged US, which the young Ellie attempts to navigate with the aid of fellow survivalist Joel after most of the human population had been wiped out. Holding true to the game, a production date has not been set as the script is still in the works and under wraps, but is said to be written by those who also helped develop the storyline for the game. No release date has been set, but more information will be released at a later date.

[b][color=white]Joaquin Phoenix in Early Talks for Doctor Strange[/color][/b]
Since Scott Derrickson was officially confirmed as the director for the film, the big question swirling around Marvel‚Äôs latest big film adaptation, [i]Doctor Strange[/i], is who will become the Sorcerer Supreme. The question may have been answered to the tune of actor/director, Joaquin Phoenix. Several big names had been rumored to be up for the role. Names such as Tom Hardy, Benedict Cumberbatch, Justin Theroux and Jared Leto, but Phoenix clears to be closer to a deal to land the role then any of the aforementioned names. While this is not official as of yet, it is also quite strange considering that Phoenix is always hesitant to take on blockbuster roles and for Marvel‚Äôs reputation for having actors sign multi-role contracts. The character of Doctor Strange was originally conjured from the brains of Stan Lee and art genius Steve Ditko, and began life as a selfish New York surgeon (named Stephen Strange) who loses his professional skills in a car crash. After falling on hard times, he visits a healer in the Himalayas known as The Ancient One, and learns to tap into psychic powers. In recognition of his selfless efforts to thwart evil fellow disciple Baron Mordo, he‚Äôs taught the mystical arts and sets out to defeat other shady sorcerers and various villains. No release date has been announced, but the confirmation ‚Äì plus Phoenix announcement or not ‚Äì should come at the company‚Äôs July 26th San Diego Comic-Con panel.

[b][color=white]Ant-Man Loses Patrick Wilson, Two More[/color][/b]
After starting out a hot mess, it appears that [i]Ant-Man[/i]'s waters have still not calmed. Three more actors who were already confirmed for the project have reportedly exited the project, including the always dependable Patrick Wilson. Although most of this seems like onset drama, it isn't entirely so. Sources say that Patrick Wilson was forced to leave because of scheduling conflicts that were created when the production of [i]Ant-Man[/i] got pushed back following director Edgar Wright‚Äôs departure earlier this summer. As for the other two, Matt Gerald and Kevin Weisman, they were allegedly written out of the script, which isn‚Äôt too much of a surprise given that the script underwent some overhaul when Adam McKay was hired to work on a new draft. More announcements are set to come about at the movies Comic-Con panel in San Deigo. 

[b][color=white]Mary-Louise Parker Joins The Blacklist[/color][/b]
After Mary-Louise's hit show "Weeds", job offers have been knocking on her door like crazy. A day after landing a role in the NBC show "The Slap", Mary-Louise has boarded the network‚Äôs buzzy drama, "The Blacklist" in a recurring role, which will be Season 2. Announced at the 2014 San Diego Comic-Con, Parker will debut in the September 22 season opener as Naomi Hyland, a woman keeping a secret from her husband and who is ‚Äúcompletely tied to Reddington,‚Äù Blacklist creator Jon Bokenkamp said. IF you have not checked out this series I would deffiently suggest you giving "The Blacklist" a shot. You can watch "The Blacklist" during its Monday time slot starting September 22, then return from a 10-week hault with a post-Super Bowl showcase, before occupying its new show time, Thursdays at 9/8c.

[b][color=white]The Simpsons and Family Guy?[/color][/b]
Yes, that is correct. If you‚Äôve always wondered what would happen if Peter Griffin and Homer Simpson were put into one show then you are in for a treat, Family Guy is about to knock you out of your chair. In the Sept. 28 season premiere, ‚ÄúThe Simpsons Guy,‚Äù the albino Griffins wind up by accident in Springfield, where they are greeted by the hepatits-y Simpsons. But a fast friendship spiced with delicious doughnuts may be forever destroyed by an argument over Pawtucket Patriot Ale and Duff Beer, which leads to an awesome fight scene. The new season will feature Meg getting recruited to be a foot-fetish model, Stewie becoming pregnant with Brian‚Äôs baby, and much more but I dont want to ruin this epic showcase that is coming to your TV's.

"What did you think of the World Cup's conclusion?"

[i]"World cup come's after 4 years and it is the dream 
of the players to win it. I supported Argentina right 
from the beginning but never knew Germany was too 
good and would defeat the others to win the cup. 
Argentina deserved to win the cup after their straight 
wins but it was Germany who became victorious. My 
eye's and probably the whole world's eyes were fixed 
on the match. After having no goals in the match, 
the match went to an extra-time. I still supported 
Argentina thinking that the match is still not over. 
Then, with seven minutes of the 120 remaining, the 
decisive moment arrived. Mario Gotze scored a stunning 
extra-time goal to settle the 2014 FIFA World Cup 
Final in Germany's favour. Argentina will still be my 
favorite. I couldn't see the whole match because of 
the time-zones but the next day i saw the highlights."[/i]
